data.title: Great ramen at Umemura
data.text:
Umemura is one of the best ramen places I have been to & I have been to several. The noodles are homemade & fresh.  

One of the keys to great ramen is a good broth & Umemura provides just that. Whether you get the traditional Shio ramen flavor, miso ramen or something else, it is all good.

Toppings are generous & also fresh & tasty. The fried rice is also very tasty.

Not a fancy restaurant, but delicious.  Also, fairly small in size, so come early, or expect some wait between 6:30 - 7:30 pm. They do turn the tables quickly, so the wait typically is not long and it's definitely worth it!!!

data.title: Authentic Heavenly Ramen - FRESH!
data.text:
Want authentic Japanese ramen?  Freshly made noodles, deliciously light broth, tender chashu all in a generous bowl of deliciousness?  Umemura is your MUST have place!  I've tried ramen in Southern Cal and NorCal and this is the only place that fulfills all parts:  fresh, tender, flavorful, authentic and generous portions.  My "Go to" dish is the Chashu ramen. Not only does it have a generous amount of pork and noodles, but the broth is delicious!  My son had the BBQ pork with miso broth and said it was the best, most tender ever.  Extra toppings may be added and in very generous portions.

The Chahan (fried rice) is flavorful and filling.

The place hasn't changed much since my own family started going when they opened, I think in the late 1980's.  New paint, lighting, fixtures.  Seating is limited and they take CASH ONLY.  Go early for seats. It's very popular, especially for the Japanese community.

The service is very prompt and friendly. The bathroom is uber-clean.

Whenever we're back in the area (original Nisei So Cal girl), it's the first stop we make whenever in town.

data.title: Excellent Japanese Noodle House
data.text: Uemura's has excellent noodles with several different soup basis and ingredients.  Piman (bell pepper and pork), mabo tofu ramen, miso ramen, kanitama ramen (crab and egg omelette mix), etc.  Yummm.  I like the Piman.  Acutally, I like most of their dishes.  And, you talk about portions.  Yee haw !

data.title: Heaven in a bowl
data.text: I LOVE the ramen at this restaurant!  I've eaten ramen in Japan and Okinawa and this place just hits the spot.  I have tried several kinds but I always go back to my favorite - Umani ramen.  The broth is wonderful, the noodles chewy, and the vegetables and egg just right.  It's a huge serving - I can never finish the whole thing.  I have introduced some friends to Umemura and they have gone back on their own.  Just went last week and cannot wait to go back.

data.title: I used to order the hyashi chuka.  It was so good.
data.text: I used to order the hyashi chuka.  It was so good.

data.title: You've gotta get the Mabotofu Han... it's off the chain!!! (and the Kanitama Chahan too!)
data.text: You've gotta get the Mabotofu Han... it's off the chain!!! (and the Kanitama Chahan too!)

data.title: On a l'impression d'être au Japon
data.text:
Visible depuis la grande route, ce petit restaurant est disposé à la japonaise avec ses petites tables et ses comptoirs sans oublier les serveuses qui parlent aussi bien anglais que japonais.
Les portions sont énormes alors cela vaut le coup :)
Les gyozas sont excellents!

data.title: カードが使えない
data.text: カード社会のロスでカードが使えず現金のみなので一人で行くには良いかも知れませんが家族などで知らずに行くと慌てる事になるので注意が必要です。

data.title: お気に入り
data.text: ここのお店はめん類、ご飯物を中心にメニューが豊富で、どれを食べても美味しい。うまにラーメンは特に私のお気に入りです！
